use-cases.title: Use Case Viewer
use-cases.uc:desc: Use cases for the Use Case Viewer application.

uc.title: View Available Documents
uc.desc: List the contents of a repository and show the available documents as a list of selectable elements.
uc.pre: Connection to a valid repository has been established.

flow.step: User enters the path of the location to view.
The location at the specified path is displayed.
The location does not denote a document: its contents are are displayed.

alternative.step: The default path is the root path of the repository

uc.uc:post:
One of the following
The contents of the newly selected path are displayed.

uc.title: View Document
uc.desc: Navigate to a path within a repository and view a document.
uc.pre: Connection to a valid repository has been established.

flow.step: The user has selected a document for viewing.
The document is loaded form the repository in the most recent version.
The raw document is transformed into a format intended for viewing.

uc.uc:post:
The document is displayed together with the following meta-information:
Revision of the document
Older revisions of this document
For each older revision two use cases can extend this use case:
, with the old use case's revision as revision
, with this use case as new revision and the other use case asold revision.

uc.title: Compare Documents
uc.desc: Compare two revisions of the same document
uc.pre: The user has selected a document and two different revisions of this document as old revision and new revision.

flow.step: Revisions old revision and new revision are loaded from the repository.
Both revisions are compared with one another.
Differences are applied as annotations to old revision.
The annotated old revision is displayed.

uc.post: The result of the comparison is displayed.

uc.title: Navigate Repository
uc.desc: Navigate to different locations in the repository. Similar to for normal repository content.
uc.pre: Connection to a valid repository has been established.

flow.step: User enters path of the location to view.
Contents of the location are displayed.

uc.post: The new location is selected. Contents of this location can be selected for navigation.
